trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings"></xref> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `profiles` section of a configuration file.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings> class provides a way to programmatically create, access, and modify the definition of an individual property added to the `properties` subsection of the `profile` section of a configuration file.
The `profile` section of the configuration file specifies a schema for user profiles.

At run time, the ASP.NET compilation system uses the information specified in the `profile` section to generate a class called `ProfileCommon`, which is derived from <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase>.
The `ProfileCommon` class definition is based on the properties defined in the `properties` subsection of the `profile` section of the configuration file.

An instance of this class is created for each user profile, and you can access the individual profile values in your code through the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Profile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
For more information about profile properties, see [ASP.NET Profile Properties Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/89439440-92ea-48c3-a4bd-dea40307899d).

For more information about the profile features added to [!INCLUDE[vstecasplong](~/includes/vstecasplong-md.md)], see [ASP.NET Profile Properties Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/89439440-92ea-48c3-a4bd-dea40307899d).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings"></xref> class with the specified name.
The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.
Setting
Default Value
`false`.
An empty string ("").
`false`.
<xref:System.Web.Configuration.SerializationMode.ProviderSpecific>.
An empty string ("").
A unique name for the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings"></xref> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings"></xref> class with the specified name and settings.

At run time, the ASP.NET compilation system uses the information specified in the `profile` section of the configuration file to generate a class called `ProfileCommon`, which is derived from <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase>.
The class allows you to access and modify the values for individual user profiles.
The `ProfileCommon` class definition is based on the properties defined in the `properties` subsection of the `profile` section of the configuration file.

The parameter values that you specify when you create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings> class will be used to define an associated property in the `ProfileCommon` class.
For more information about profile properties, see [ASP.NET Profile Properties Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/89439440-92ea-48c3-a4bd-dea40307899d).
A unique name for the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings"></xref> object.
`true` to indicate that the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class should be read-only; otherwise, `false`.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.SerializationMode"></xref> values.
The name of a provider from the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSection.Providers"></xref> property, or an empty string ("").
A string containing the default value used for the named property in the generated page Profile class.
A valid type reference or an empty string.

`true` to indicate associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class should support anonymous users; otherwise, `false`, to indicate that anonymous users cannot change the named property.
A string containing provider-specific information used by the provider associated with the property.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class can be set by anonymous users.

At run time, the ASP.NET compilation system uses the information specified in the `profile` section of the configuration file to generate a class called `ProfileCommon`, which is derived from <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase>.
The class allows you to access and modify the values for individual user profiles.
The `ProfileCommon` class definition is based on the properties defined in the `properties` subsection of the `profile` section of the configuration file.
The property values that you specify for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings> class will be used to define an associated property in the `ProfileCommon` class.

An exception is thrown if a property in the `ProfileCommon` class is changed by an anonymous user when the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings.AllowAnonymous%2A> property value is `false`.
`true` if the associated property in the `ProfileCommon` class can be set by anonymous users; otherwise, `false`, indicating that anonymous users cannot change the property value.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a string of custom data for the profile property provider.
A string of custom data for the profile property provider.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the default value used for the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class.

At run time, the ASP.NET compilation system uses the information specified in the `profile` section of the configuration file to generate a class called `ProfileCommon`, which is derived from <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase>.
The class allows you to access and modify the values for individual user profiles.
The `ProfileCommon` class definition is based on the properties defined in the `properties` subsection of the `profile` section of the configuration file.
The property values that you specify for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings> class will be used to define an associated property in the `ProfileCommon` class.
The default value is used as the initial value for the associated `ProfileCommon` class property when an individual user profile does not contain a value for the property.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings.DefaultValue%2A> property may be a string value, an XML-encoded value (serialization mode for the property is XML serialization) or a base-64-encoded binary string (if the serialization mode for the property is binary serialization).
A string containing the default value used for the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings"></xref> object and the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class.

At run time, the ASP.NET compilation system uses the information specified in the `profile` section of the configuration file to generate a class called `ProfileCommon`, which is derived from <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase>.
The class allows you to access and modify the values for individual user profiles.
The `ProfileCommon` class definition is based on the properties defined in the `properties` subsection of the `profile` section of the configuration file.
The property values that you specify for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings> class will be used to define an associated property in the `ProfileCommon` class.
A string containing the name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings"></xref> object.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the name of a provider to use when serializing the named property.
Profile providers are data sources in which user-profile values are stored.
You can specify profile providers in the `providers` subsection of the `profile` section of a configuration file.
If the value of this property is an empty string, the default provider specified in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSection.DefaultProvider%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is used.
The name of a provider from the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSection.Providers"></xref> property, or an empty string ("").
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class is read-only.

At run time, the ASP.NET compilation system uses the information specified in the `profile` section of the configuration file to generate a class called `ProfileCommon`, which is derived from <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase>.
The class allows you to access and modify the values for individual user profiles.
The `ProfileCommon` class definition is based on the properties defined in the `properties` subsection of the `profile` section of the configuration file.
The property values that you specify for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfilePropertySettings> class will be used to define an associated property in the `ProfileCommon` class.
`true` if the associated property in the `ProfileCommon` class is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the serialization method used for the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class.
For more information about profile properties, see [ASP.NET Profile Properties Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/89439440-92ea-48c3-a4bd-dea40307899d).
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.SerializationMode"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.SerializationMode.ProviderSpecific"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the type of the associated property in the dynamically generated `ProfileCommon` class.
When set to a valid type reference, this type is used for the named property in the generated `ProfileCommon` class.
The type reference is formed as follows (items in brackets are not required): `Namespace.Typename, Assemblyname[,] [Version=x,] [Culture=y,] [PublicKeyToken=z]`
For example:
A valid, fully qualified type reference, or an empty string ("").
The default is an empty string.
